page.title: 16WILDLIFE CONTROL,DORNIE
page.content: Mr J Grant has worked as a Forest Ranger with the Forestry Commission for the past 35 years. He was brought up in the country and has always had an interest in wildlife.When he was young his family had to catch rabbits as one of their main sources of food and this taught him much of how animals live.He saw the damage foxes and deer can do.His main job now is to prevent them damaging the young trees. He also has to reduce the number of foxes to prevent them taking too many lambs.His method of control is by shooting.He attempts to keep a balance in the population to ensure that there is sufficient food available for those animals which survive.
